definition: to obtain (information from an archive etc)
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody
to take/to get/to choose/to fetch

sentences.english: No unit or individual may have cultural relics transferred without approval.
sentences.chinese: 未经批准，任何单位或者个人不得调取文物。

sentences.english: That familiar place will be your guide to store and recall any kind of information.
sentences.chinese: 这个熟悉的地方将成为你储存和调取任何信息的指南。

sentences.english: This allows it to draw on resources from across the country.
sentences.chinese: 这使得美国从全国调取物资，来应对这次的漏油事件。

sentences.english: If it is necessary for the people's court to obtain proofs, the clues for the proofs shall be accompanied.
sentences.chinese: 需要申请人民法院调取证据的，应当附有证据线索。

sentences.english: The court ordered certiorari following judicial review.
sentences.chinese: 在司法复审后，该法院命令调取案卷。

sentences.english: This allows it to draw on resources from across the country to deal with the leak.
sentences.chinese: 这使得美国从全国调取物资，来应对这次的漏油事件。

a suspect
to monitor
civil police/PRC police/abbr. for 人民警察
to collect evidence
to investigate a crime on the spot/to occur (of a crime)/to be discovered (of a crime)

to deploy surveillance/to put under surveillance
thorough search
to report a case to the authorities
to investigate/examination
to cause an accident/to be responsible for an incident/to provoke a disturbance

(of police, fire brigade etc) to receive a report of an incident
